section.title: Adding a Template
section.text: There are several important items missing from the base-type. These are covered by Monstrous Templates which add things such as mental attributes (and Cha!), special abilities, and a description of the monster, including any relavent interaction statistics, such as combat, elocution etc.

chapter.title: Traits
chapter.text: Traits are supernatural (supernormal or paranormal) capabilities. They are differentiated from because they are singular in nature. For instance, a trait could be a specific power that a monster has, a specific power of a SuperHero. It can be the result of means magical, chemical, mutation, or some future technology.

The important part is that the power occurs singularly and uniquely and is not part of some larger “system,” i.e. . are generally bought at only one level, but can be purchased at higher levels, if it is pertinent. If a needs “points” to power it, these are taken from the character's Mana Points.
Since many traits overlap magical spells, there is a specific trait designed for using abilities to some specific spell, this trait is called .

datum.name: Acrobatics
datum.field: The ability to perform acrobatic feats of dexterity such as flips, mid-air grabs, cartwheels, and similar exercises. When accompanied with a skill such as dodge, it will allow the character to perform acrobatics while dodging or other similar movement.

datum.name: Advanced Academic
datum.field: Advanced knowledge in one specific area of academics. This is usually in a prior area of expertise. For example, a Biologist (high level Biology skill) might have the skill.

datum.name: Advanced Communications
datum.field: The character has the knowledge of advanced communication systems, their use, limitations, abilities, satellites, industrial networking, and similar information. This also gives the character to use the tools and instruments used within the communications field.

datum.name: Alchemy
datum.field: Knowledge of `primitive' chemistry and related techniques. A person with this skill will know how to prepare simple chemicals (including such things as simple medicines, poisons, black powder, etc) from natural sources. This skill can also be used to prepare alchemical equivalents of magical potions at -2 LVL.

datum.name: Alectromancy
datum.field: The (magical) art of divining answers to questions using a chicken.

datum.name: Ambush
datum.field: The knowledge of how to surprise someone or something---often by means of diversion or camouflage.

datum.name: Anatomy
Ancient History
datum.field: The knowledge of history starting at 5000 years ago and extending back further. A person with this skill would know major historical events, figures, and common beliefs and myths of the various cultures existing during that time period. Higher levels represent more in-depth knowledge.

datum.name: Animal Handling
datum.field: Dealing with animals. Wild or domestic.

datum.name: Appraisal
datum.field: Knowledge of determining the value of items. Typically, the character should also have knowledge of the area.

datum.name: Archaeology
datum.field: The scientific study of cultural or natural remains, artifacts, and structures. A person with this skill would know how to excavate and preserve delicate artifacts, and how to identify them. He would also have knowledge of various past cultures, etc.

datum.name: Architecture
datum.field: The artistic creation and basic structural design of buildings and similar structures. A person with this skill will also recognize weak points of structures, and will have a high amount of intuition as to the location of doors, hallways, etc. hidden or otherwise.

datum.name: Arguing
datum.field: The skill of winning an argument, by presenting a strong case and pointing out the flaws and errors made by the person you are arguing with. A person with this skill will be excellent at convincing others of his ideas, etc. Lawyers, politicians, philosophers, law enforcement, magistrates, etc commonly possess this skill.

datum.name: Armory
datum.field: The knowledge of the suitability of armor, armor theory, and how to make armor. In archaic settings, this would include the skills to directly make simple armor (or complex armor in conjunction with blacksmithing). In modern settings, this includes the ability to design armor or repair it, but not the skills to make it (that would require materials science, mechanical engineering, machining, etc.) A player with this skill would know the strengths and weaknesses of the armor of his enemies.

datum.name: Art
datum.field: Artistic skills are the production of a particular type of art. You may choose the type of art, such as painting, drawing, sculpture, calligraphy, etc.

datum.name: Astrology
datum.field: How to read the future in the stars; determine the course of events; auspicous days etc.

datum.name: Athletics
datum.field: The knowledge of a particular type of sport. Examples are football, tae-kwon do, soccer, and jai alai.

datum.name: Audio/Video
datum.field: intelligence, thief, cameraman, security guard, musician

The knowledge of various Audio/Video systems and their components, and how to assemble and operate such systems. In a modern campaign setting, this would include knowledge of such things as video sources (VCRs, DVD, etc.), displays (projectors, TVs), audio formats (CD, Record, tape), and their associated hardware, like amplifiers, speakers, etc. Professional musicians, producers for music or film, home theater enthusiasts, etc, would commonly possess this skill.

datum.name: Bargaining/Haggling
datum.field: This imparts the ability to haggle over the price of goods or services, and the trading of goods and services for one another. People with this skill (salesmen, store clerks, antique dealers) will know how to get the maximum money for a product when selling it, and how to get the lowest possible price when purchasing goods.

datum.name: Beauty
datum.field: The physical beauty of a person, and how to accentuate it with actions, poises, as well as selection of clothing, makeup, etc.

datum.name: Biology
datum.field: The scientific study of life. This academic skill includes the description, classification, and knowledge of function of all different life forms, including people, animals, single-cell organisms, etc.

datum.name: Botany
datum.field: The knowledge of how plants grow, and their biological processes, etc. Persons with this skill can identify plants---including those that are medicinal, poisonous, or edible.

datum.name: Bureaucracy
datum.field: diplomat, law enforcement, organized crime, politician

Experience with dealing with the political, legal, and related processes of the time. People with this skill will know ways around [latex]`red tape'[/latex] and how to favorably deal with public services and government agencies.

datum.name: Business Sense
datum.field: The ability to determine 'good deals' and make quick business deals in order to profit from them. Persons with this skill will be good at recognizing good and bad business propositions, as well as bargains or rip-offs in the common marketplace. This skill gives the holder $50 per level per week, if he/she is in an area with people and business dealings.

datum.name: Carpentry
datum.field: The knowledge of woodworking. A person with this skill will know how to use woodworking tools, and can produce and repair things such as tools, furniture, and buildings (and building subcomponents) from wood.

datum.name: Cash
datum.field: Unique skill. This provides the character money. Character gets (LVL[latex]$^2$[/latex])*1000 dollars in cash, equipment, or goods. This can be bought many times.

datum.name: Chemistry
Civil Engineering
datum.field: The design of public works projects such as buildings, bridges, roadways, railroads, sewers, gas and electric services, etc.

datum.name: Climbing
datum.field: The ability to climb things such as trees, buildings, walls, rock formations, ice, etc. This includes free climbing, and climbing with equipment.

datum.name: Communications
datum.field: The knowledge of basic communication such as hand signals and gesturing, as well as modern communications methods like telephone, radio, and computerized communication---and their associated equipment.

datum.name: Computer Programming
datum.field: The knowledge of how to write code for computers. This includes knowledge of programming languages, basic operation of the computer, and how to construct algorithms to solve problems. Computer programming implies the computer use skill. (you get computer use free with programming)

datum.name: Computer Use
datum.field: The ability to use a computer for work and pleasure. This includes how to perform simple computer-related tasks, such as setting up a computer, basic repairs, and how to use common software---like word processing, spreadsheets, image viewing, E-mail, and Internet browsing.

datum.name: Construction
datum.field: The knowledge of working on a construction site. This includes preparing a site for building, reading plans---blueprints, surveying and laying a foundation, framing, and finishing a building or other structure. This also includes the use of common construction tools and heavy equipment including power tools, dump trucks, cement mixers, backhoes, and cranes. A person with this skill will also have experience with mixing concrete, laying bricks, and working with lumber and structural steel---as well as SIMPLE plumbing, electrical, and carpentry tasks.

datum.name: Cooking
datum.field: The skill of preparing various dishes from scratch. A person with this skill will know many recipes, how to select and prepare ingredients, and how to cook and present a finished dish or meal. (Skill level 3 would be a professional Chef)

datum.name: Cryptography
datum.field: The study of codes, including how to create, identify, and break them.

datum.name: Cyber Medicine
datum.field: The study of cybernetics as they relate to the human body. People with this skill are knowledgeable about cybernetics, how they function, and how to design and modify or repair them. A person with this skill and the appropriate supplies can work on cyborgs.

datum.name: Dancing
datum.field: The ability to dance. Choose a particular type, such as Ballroom, Country and Western, Swing, etc.

datum.name: Deception
datum.field: Con artist, thief, crooked businessman, stage magician

The ability to hide the truth about something, or make things appear different than they really are, by talking about them. This is NOT lying outright, etc, but cleverly presenting the evidence to further your goal. This is usually achieved by downplaying or carefully ignoring some information while strategically emphasizing other points. Bending the truth, rationalizing things, etc, falls under this skill.

datum.name: Decorating
datum.field: How to decorate that is pleasing to the eye.

datum.name: Diplomacy
datum.field: The ability to negotiate and broker deals for business, political, and legal purposes. A person with this skill will know how to make compromises that best suit his goals, and will be able to deal with people in tense situations without angering them.

datum.name: Disguise
datum.field: Characters with Disguise know how to make themselves look like someone else. Either to copy the looks of another person or to just change the appearance of the character. This also includes the ability to detect if someone else is in disguise.

datum.name: Drink Mixing
datum.field: Knowledge of drinks, how to make them, etc.

datum.name: Electrical Engineering
datum.field: The academic skill of the design and function of electronics and electrical systems. A person with this skill would know how to design and analyze electronic devices.

datum.name: Electrician
datum.field: The practical knowledge of the electrical wiring of homes and buildings. A person with this skill will know about the electrical wiring in buildings, and how to repair and modify such things. This includes the use of related tools, and how to identify problems and parts.

datum.name: Electronic Warfare
datum.field: The knowledge of electronic technology such as communications jamming, stealth technology, ECM, ECCM, and related topics as applied to electronics in war or combat situations.

datum.name: Electronics
datum.field: The practical skill of building, troubleshooting, and repairing electronic devices. A person with this skill would have only basic knowledge of designing electronic devices, [latext]\textit{but}[\latex] they are skilled in repairing, modifying, and working on electronic items. This includes use of electronic tools such as test equipment, soldering gear, etc.

datum.name: Entertaining
datum.field: The skill of entertaining people by telling jokes, simple performances, and improvising. Being comfortable and at ease around people.

datum.name: Escape
Espionage/surveillance
datum.field: Military specialist, thief, detective, private investigator

The skills required to find out information by observing others and their actions. Includes techniques for watching people and listening in on their conversations, etc, from a distance. Also, how to set up stakeouts and use technology (cameras, bugs, etc) to perform these tasks falls under the scope of this skill.

datum.name: Faith
datum.field: The belief in a particular religion, God(s), or a spiritual philosophy. Note that this skill is true belief in that religion, not simply knowledge about it. This skill is use for Faith-type magic. See magic section for more details

datum.name: Falling
datum.field: The character knows how to fall from a fall distance. When falling, the character can roll his skill. He can fall 10 feet per success without taking damage. Beyond that, he takes the normal 1D6 per 10 feet.

datum.name: Farming
datum.field: Knowledge growing crops, harvesting, etc. Includes knowledge of raising common farm animals and working with farm equipment.

datum.name: Fashion
datum.field: Knowledge and selection of clothing and related items to maximize beauty, or to convey a particular image.

datum.name: Filmography
datum.field: The knowledge of how to make movies, commercials, and other video productions. Includes knowledge of directing, sets, working with actors, simple effects, and film editing.

datum.name: First Aid/Paramedicine
datum.field: Basic first aid treatment for various common injuries. Includes knowledge of basic medication, bandaging, treatment of wounds, stabilizing victims, and performing very simple medical procedures in the field. A successful use of this skill will stop a person below 0 hit points from losing any more, this takes a turn to attempt.

datum.name: Forensics
datum.field: Deducing the nature of a crime or other event based on evidence, especially minimal evidence. Taking and matching fingerprints, analyzing handwriting, notes, threats, study of weapons or other objects used in crimes, etc.

datum.name: Forgery
datum.field: The knowledge of how to forge signatures, documents, insignia, etc. and how to detect forged work.

datum.name: Gambling
datum.field: The knowledge of card and casino games, such as poker, blackjack, craps, baccarat, roulette, etc. This includes how to play the games, rules, the odds of winning, etc.

datum.name: Geology
datum.field: The academic study of the earth and its geological formations---including rocks, minerals, and related scientific elements. A person with this skill would know how to identify various geological features, including gems, etc.

datum.name: Glassblowing
datum.field: The art of glass-blowing. How to make, shape, and judge glass. How to make objects, and sculptures; things like idols, plateware, jugs, abstract art, etc. The ability to be artistic is governed by this skill. If the character also has blacksmithing, carpentry, etc. they can make their own tools, and forge. The ability to design new types of glass requires alchemy or chemistry.

datum.name: Graphic Arts
datum.field: The design and layout of printed matter, such as books, magazines, newspapers, and posters and advertising materials. Includes designing such works for maximum readability and visual impact, as well as the production of printed materials. This involves typesetting, production of master copies, operating a printing press, and desktop publishing on a computer.

datum.name: Gunsmithing
datum.field: The ability to design, repair, modify, and build handguns, shotguns, and rifles. A person with this skill cannot build a gun from scratch, but can build guns from raw parts, and is skilled in the modification and tuning of firearms.

datum.name: Hacking/Cracking
datum.field: The art of gaining access to computer systems and software by indirect means. This often includes breaking into secured systems or networks. Password cracking, enabling protected software, etc. falls under this skill.

datum.name: History
datum.field: Historical knowledge extending from the present until 5000 years in the past. Persons with this skill will know about major political figures (and other famous people), wars, famines, natural disasters, and major cultural---scientific---religious events and discoveries made during that time.

datum.name: Hit Points
datum.field: Adds HitPoints to your character. You get two per CP spent.

datum.name: Holistic Medicine
datum.field: Non-traditional medicine, such as acupuncture, massage therapy, use of herbal drugs, etc. Choose a branch when selecting this skill (example

datum.name: Hunting
datum.field: The ability to locate, stalk, and kill game. This includes looking for game animals and signs of their presence, tracking, and techniques for stalking them. Also, using weapons (such as bows, firearms, spears, etc.) and traps to kill game, and how to butcher game in the field for meat and skins.

datum.name: Impersonation/Acting
datum.field: The skills of portraying a character or person other than oneself. Includes how to alter voice, habits and mannerisms---as well as basic costuming, etc. in order to play the part. This skill is used for professional actors, and for espionage purposes.

datum.name: Inspire Emotion
datum.field: The ability to manipulate the emotions of others by interacting with them. Through verbal communication and body language, a person with this skill can cause others to become happy, sad, etc.

datum.name: Interrogation
datum.field: Extracting information or answers to specific questions from someone through various means. This might include deceiving the target, befriending them, convincing them, intimidation/blackmail, or even torture.

datum.name: Intuition
datum.field: Law enforcement, soldier, almost any other occupation

The ability to guess well in situations where a person is unsure about two or more options. A person with this skill tends to guess correctly between options more than statistics would predict. This skill can only be used if the character had some knowledge in the general area of the guess to be made.

datum.name: Investigation
Journalism
datum.field: Researching recent events and reporting on them concisely. This skill is common for newspapers and TV news station crews.

datum.name: Language
datum.field: The knowledge of a language. Possessing this skill implies proficiency of one language. Purchase this skill separately for each language a person knows. Higher levels imply greater proficiency, eloquence, and superior vocabulary. Note that if you purchase Literacy and Language together (the same language) you may purchase Language as a LVL 1 skill.

datum.name: Leadership
datum.field: The ability to observe situations, prioritize activities related to them, and guide people through them. All characters under the leadership of someone with this skill may add X to each of their initiative numbers. (The person with the leadership skill may do this as well) X is the number of successes on the leadership roll.

datum.name: Leatherwork
datum.field: Working with leather and leather goods. This includes the tanning of leather, forming it into shapes (such as bags, pouches, saddles, clothing items, weapon sheaths, etc.), and sewing it into useable goods.

datum.name: Legal
datum.field: Knowledge of legal systems and how to use them.

datum.name: Literacy
datum.field: The ability to write and read a written language. Note that if you purchase Literacy and Language together (the same language) you may purchase Language as a LVL 1 skill.

datum.name: Literature
datum.field: The knowledge of well-known literature (famous works and authors), as well as general rhetoric and literary expression. Note that this is not the same thing as language, literacy, or writing.

datum.name: Lockpicking
datum.field: The knowledge of locks, how to open them without a key, and how locks (both simple and complex) operate. This includes the use of lock-opening tools such as picks, etc.

datum.name: Luck
datum.field: [LaTeX] The maximum value of the character's \emph{Luck} subattribute is increased by one.

datum.name: Lying
datum.field: Knowing how to tell a lie is a fine art, and this character knows it. The character can tell a convincing lie and to develop plausible alibis. This also allows the character to detect that someone else is lying.

datum.name: Machining
Magical Control
datum.field: This skill represents a magic user's ability to accurately control magic energy and make it do what she wants it to. See magic section for full information.

datum.name: Magical Studies
datum.field: The academic study of magic and related processes. A character may also use this skill to identify magical items (requires touching them). It also allows a character to read magical script such as that used in spell books.

datum.name: Mana Points
datum.field: How to add arbitrary mana points.

datum.name: Management
datum.field: The ability to manage people and resources in order to accomplish a certain task. This is primarily in business personnel, as well as military commanders, etc.

datum.name: Marine Piloting
datum.field: Knowledge of piloting a ship or boat. The knowledge of maritime laws, practices, and the general maintenance and operation of boats and ships fall under the scope of this skill.

datum.name: Martial Arts
datum.field: (See Martial Arts section) This is the governing skill of the Martial Arts subsystem. It represents the level of skill that a person has in martial arts. No person may posses a martial arts technique of higher rank than his or her level of martial arts.

datum.name: Materials Science
datum.field: The knowledge of various natural and processed substances and their uses and applications. This is a supporting skill for many engineering skills, etc.

datum.name: Mathematics
datum.field:
[LaTeX]
Knowledge of mathematical theory and techniques for apply mathematics to real life situations.

datum.name: Mecha Electronics
datum.field: The electronics skill as applied to Mecha. This includes the design and modification of the electrical systems of mechs, including computers, sensors, and related components.

datum.name: Mecha Piloting
datum.field: The ability to operate a Mech. This skill is required in order for a character to operate a Mech. While piloting a mech, any DEX-based skill you want to use cannot have a higher level than this skill. See Mecha rules for more information.

datum.name: Mechanic
datum.field: The skills for performing maintenance, repair, and related work on cars, trucks, buses, and motorcycles. In short, just about any vehicle except aircraft and mecha.

datum.name: Mechanical Engineering
datum.field: The academic study of mechanical parts and systems. This includes such things as machinery, controls, structural design, etc. A person with this skill would be adept at designing mechanical things, and analyzing the designs of others. This skill does NOT imply the ability to make a mechanical device.

datum.name: Medical
datum.field: Professional medicine. The study of the human body, its ailments, and how to treat them. Lvl 1 = Pre-Med Student, Lvl 2 = Med School Graduate--Resident, Lvl 3 = Inexperienced MD. You may choose the area of expertise

datum.name: Medical Emergency
datum.field: The ability to fix wounds 'in the field'. This can be done as a standard action.

datum.name: Military Strategy
Mining
datum.field: The ability to correctly assess the ability to mine a large, long, deep tunnel. How to go about digging the tunnel, and all the logistics and equipment needed for the mine.

datum.name: Music
datum.field: The ability to play an instrument. Select what instrument when you pick this skill. This implies the ability to read music.

datum.name: Mythology
datum.field: The knowledge of the myths, superstitions, and religious beliefs of past civilizations. This can be generic overall knowledge, or specific and in-depth in one particular area.

datum.name: Navigation
datum.field: How to plot and plan directions and courses in natural settings.

datum.name: Pharmacology
datum.field: The dispensing, dosage calculation, and selection of drugs. How to make pills or liquid medicines (from the raw medicine), and the knowledge of what existing drugs work for what ailments; knowledge of combined effects from mixing drugs, etc.

datum.name: Philosophy
datum.field: Study of any particular type of philosophy or outlook on life (or general knowledge of several). Academic skill.

datum.name: Photography
datum.field: The skills associated with taking pictures. The selection and operation of cameras (still and video), use of lenses and filters, taking pictures in various different conditions, working with film, as well as developing and editing prints.

datum.name: Physics
Plumbing
datum.field: The repair and installation of piping, drains, and fixtures (sinks, bathtubs, water heaters, etc.) in and around buildings. Includes working with piping, fittings, etc. for both water and gas use.

datum.name: Politics
datum.field: Affinity for politics; knowledge of the political process, political groups and their agendas--public and private. The knowledge of current political events, deal making, vote gathering, and lobbying fall under this scope of this skill.

datum.name: Psionic Studies
datum.field: The academic study of Pisioncs; including how psionic powers work, what they do, and what their limitations are. This skill is NOT required to use psionic abilities.

datum.name: Riding
datum.field: Riding an animal. Select the type of animal for the skill. Common examples are horses, camels, elephants, etc. This skill can be taken for any riding animal. The skill also includes basic care, grooming and feeding of the animal.

datum.name: Robotics
datum.field: The scientific knowledge and practical engineering experience associated with working on robots. Much like how a mechanic works on cars, a person with robotics is skilled at working on robots. This includes designing robots (greatly aided with mechanical and electrical engineering), and repairing or modifying them.

datum.name: Ropes and Rigging
datum.field: Tying knots, working with ropes and cables for purposes of lifting and securing loads, etc. Sailors, dockworkers, crane crews, truckers, climbers, etc commonly possess this skill. Persons with this skill know what knots to use when and how to tie them. Also gives the character the knowledge on the suitability of ropes and cables for different applications.

datum.name: Rune Magic
datum.field: The academic study of rune magic. No character may learn a rune spell of higher rank than his level of this skill. (See Rune Magic system...)

datum.name: SCUBA Diving
datum.field: The knowledge of how to use assist equipment for underwater diving. This includes SCUBA systems, air tanks, surface compressors, diving suits, and related devices. Persons with this skill will know how to avoid decompression sickness, how to communicate underwater by means of signals, and how to recover small to mid-sized objects underwater.

datum.name: Sailing
datum.field: Knowledge of sailboats and how to sail them. This includes setting up and working with sails and rigging, steering, etc. A person with this skill will have basic navigation knowledge, and knowledge of maritime laws.

datum.name: Sales
datum.field: The ability to sell something. A person with this skill will be adept at marketing and promotion of goods and services, finding buyers, negotiating prices, etc.

datum.name: Scrounging
datum.field: Knowledge of how and where to look for items, but not from 'normal' sources. People with this skill are known for their ability to find just about anything--even if that means digging around in dumpsters, pawnshops, and similar locations.

datum.name: Security
datum.field: The knowledge of how to protect persons, objects, and places. This includes use of security systems, surveillance equipment, and guard personnel. A person with this skill knows how to use these measures to protect things, and also recognizes their weaknesses, as well as common tactics used to breach them.

datum.name: Seduction
datum.field: The use of oneself to make other people to do what they want. This might include faking friendship or romantic interest, deceptive speech, and use of physical attractiveness.

datum.name: Singing
datum.field: The ability to sing. This can be any type of music. This skill implies the ability to read music.

datum.name: Sleight of Hand
datum.field: This skill includes things such as stage magic, palming things, concealment, etc. A person with this skill can perform various card tricks, other magic tricks, and would be skilled at palming objects, or making objects 'appear' from thin air. This could be used for tricks, stealing small objects, or concealing small weapons.

datum.name: Smithing
Spellcasting
datum.field: The skill of casting magical spells, invocation style. You cannot purchase a spell whose rank is higher than your level of this skill. It provides additional MP as well. See magic section for full information.

datum.name: Stealth
datum.field: Stealth gives the character the ability to move silently through his or her surroundings.

datum.name: Streetwise
datum.field: The knowledge of how the streets 'work'; things like cants, where to find contacts, etc.

datum.name: Summoning
datum.field: A variant of magic applied to calling forth animals and various creatures to assist the caster. See the Summoning Magic text for more information.

datum.name: Supernatural Lore
datum.field: The knowledge of little known or unusual mythology, especially that involving ghosts, monsters, undead, werewolves or vampires, etc. A person with this skill will have knowledge of various mythical (and real) beasts, monsters, etc. including their appearance, strengths--weaknesses, etc.

datum.name: Survival
datum.field: The ability to find food, water, and shelter in most any situation. Includes making simple shelters (lean-tos, tents, stick houses, etc.), making a fire, collecting food and water, and avoiding harm from the elements (extreme temperatures), dangerous animals, etc.

datum.name: Swimming
datum.field: Similar to Athletics, but specifically swimming and diving skills. Imparts the endurance and techniques to swim long distances, etc.

datum.name: Teaching
datum.field: The ability to teach skills you know to others.

datum.name: Theology
datum.field: The knowledge of religion and how to argue about religion. Non-historical in nature.

datum.name: Throwing
datum.field: Throwing things with accuracy and power. This could be a rock, baseball, grenade, or whatever. A person with this skill can throw things much more accurately and further than a normal person. (Note, this skill can be used in combat to strike with grenades or similar thrown weapons. However, throwing knives, shuriken, etc. are a different skill)

datum.name: Tracking
datum.field: The ability to follow something (animal, person, or vehicle) based on the signs it left behind. This includes such things as identifying and following tracks, finding hidden or covered tracks, and how to disguise tracks.

datum.name: Trivia
datum.field: The knowledge of unusual or generally useless facts like obscure history, sports stats, info about actors and actresses, etc. This is the kind of knowledge one would need to do well at trivia games, like Trivial Pursuit and Jeopardy.

datum.name: Vehicle Piloting
datum.field: Truck driver, construction worker, some soldiers
The ability to drive land-based vehicles other than automobiles or motorcycles. This would apply to things like heavy trucks, buses, tanks, construction equipment, forklifts, and other things.

datum.name: Veterinary Medicine
datum.field: The medicine skill applied to animals. See Medicine skill for more detail.

datum.name: Weaponry
datum.field: Knowledge of weapons design, suitability of weapons, and how to make weapons. In an archaic setting, this would include how to make simple weapons. In a modern setting, one could design weapons, but might not be able to build them (that might require such skills as mechanical or electrical engineering, machining, etc.)

datum.name: Whore
datum.field: This is effectively a specialization of the skill

datum.name: Work
datum.field: Special skill. This can be thought of as a resume or work experience. It implies that you have work experience and higher levels mean you are a desirable employee. Talk to your GM about what this skill does for you.

datum.name: Writing
datum.field: The ability to write convincing literary works. This could be poetry or prose, fiction or nonfiction. (This is NOT the skill of being literate. This is the skill of being a good writer).

datum.name: Zero-G
datum.field: Imparts the ability to control one's body movements effectively in low-G or zero-G environments such as in space, freefall, or underwater.

datum.name: Zoology
datum.field: The academic study of animals; including their biology and their behavior, etc.

datum.name: Arm Blades
datum.field: One or more metal blades is inserted into the forearm. It can extend forward or swing out from the back of the arm. The blades are used with the small sword skill and can deal 1D6+2 S

datum.name: Arm Guards
datum.field: Special armor plating is inserted into the back of the forearm. This makes the forearm and effective tool for parrying melee attacks. Armor is 5/9/5

datum.name: Climbing Hands
datum.field: A special set of hands designed to improve your ability to climb. -1 DEX for normal tasks. +4 to climbing rolls. When combined with Climbing Feet, bonus is a total of +6

datum.name: Concealed Gun
datum.field: A semiautomatic gun, in any normal pistol caliber, can be concealed in the forearm

datum.name: Extendable Arms
datum.field: The ability to extend your arms up to twice their normal length. You have -3 STR with the arms fully extended. They can be extended and contracted at wll.

datum.name: Finger Sprayer
datum.field: This device, when implanted into a hand, can be used to spray chemicals a short distance away. It can't store very much liquid, however.

datum.name: Grip Lock
datum.field: This allows the user to lock his grip on an object. When locked, it requires 5 greater than the user's STR to un-break the grip. It also gives +5 to STR checks for holding onto an object.

datum.name: Heated Hand
datum.field: This modification gives your hands -1 DEX, but allows you to heat your palms to a significant temperatures. This can be used to deal 1D4 U damage in an attack, or for cooking food, etc.

datum.name: Hollow Arm
datum.field: Gives 2 slots in either arm. 1 in upper arm, one in lower arm.

datum.name: Palm Sheild
datum.field: An armored palm can be used as a shield to block attacks, etc. The palm has 6/8/4 armor after this modification.

datum.name: Subdermal Watch
datum.field: A luminescent watch is implanted beneath the skin somewhere on the body. It is usually in the wrist area. It tells perfect time, and you can't ever loose it!

datum.name: Tool Hands
datum.field: Small tools, similar to a swiss army knife, are implanted into the hands. They aren't strong enough for tough jobs, but are very handy for light work. Includes a small knife, scissors, file, saw, various screwdrivers, bottle/can opener, etc.

datum.name: Typing Hands
datum.field: Robotic fingers can split apart into six individual micro-fingers. This allows one to type on a keyboard much faster than with normal hands. When in "typing mode", hand has a STR of 2.

datum.name: Abnormal Articulation
datum.field: A modification to your joints. It enables a given joint to move in a manner in which it normally couldn't. (so, you could bend your knee backwards, for example)

datum.name: Alternate Digestive Orifice
datum.field: Adds another orificice to the body (or adapts an existing one), enabling you to eat from it. Thus, it's possible to eat through your ear, etc.

datum.name: Climate Adaptability
datum.field: Improves your ability to survive and perform in odd enviornments, such as deserts, snow, high altitude, etc.

datum.name: Cosmetic Addition
datum.field: A minor cosmetic modification to the body, such as skin ridges, changing the shape of part of the body, etc.

datum.name: Dermal Backlight
datum.field: Makes your skin glow. You can turn it on and off at will

datum.name: Detachable Joint
datum.field: Enables a certain joint in the body (knee, wrist, elbow, etc.) to be detached and re-connected at will. This enables you to switch limbs or "attachments" on your body.

datum.name: Dynochromatic Skin
datum.field: Change the color of your skin. It can be changed to any color, or patterns, etc. Changing takes a few seconds.

datum.name: Easy Maintenance
datum.field: Makes healing your body and working on your cybernetics unusually easy. Downtime is reduced by half.

datum.name: Electrically Shielded Body
datum.field: Protects the body from electrical damage. Take only 50% damage from electrical attacks unless they originate from inside the body.

datum.name: False Bleeding
datum.field: Make yourself bleed at will, for no reason, and without harm. You can stop the false bleeding at will.

datum.name: Fireproof Skin
datum.field: Prevents the skin from burning in normal situations. You take half damage from short-term contact with fire.

datum.name: Gills
datum.field: Enables you to "breate" water naturally. Usually installed on the neck, but could be anywhere. The Gills are a sensitive organ.

datum.name: Hair Control
datum.field: Enables you to control the look of your hair at will. This can do anything that normal hair styling can do, and affects the entire body

datum.name: Hard Skin
datum.field: Hardens the skin all over your body. 3/0/0

datum.name: Increased STR for muscles
datum.field: Upgrade the STR of your muscles. Can be purchased as many times as you want. Each purchase is +1 STR

datum.name: Increased Twitch Fibers
datum.field: Increases the amount of fast-twitch muscle fiber in your body. Gain +3 STR for fast applications, but suffer a -1 BLD. You also suffer and -3 STR for anything that takes longer than a second. -2 Enc

datum.name: Increased perception (sense skin)
datum.field: Improves the sensitivity of your skin. You can accuratley determine the shape, size, texture, and temperature of objects touching you.

datum.name: Increased speed of Wings
datum.field: Adds speed to your wings. Each purchase is +20 MPH

datum.name: Melanin Control
datum.field: Change the color of your skin. It works fairly slowly, and can only be used to match normal "human color" skin. It can be white, black, "yellow". You can simulate tans, etc, but cannot do unnatural colors.

datum.name: Muscle replacement
datum.field: Replace your muscles with superior lab-grown ones. +1 STR and +1 BLD

datum.name: Myomer muscle fibers
datum.field: Muscle enhancement which improves motor control. Each purchase adds +1 DEX. Can be purchased more than once, but each consecutive purchase is twice the cost of the previous one.

datum.name: Nervous System replacement
datum.field: Replaces your nervous system (except the brain) with an electronic network.

datum.name: Pain Editior
datum.field: Enables you to shut off or dimininsh pain at your will

datum.name: Radiation Immunity
datum.field: Protects the body from radiation from outside sources. Will not protect you from ingesting radioactive materials, etc.

datum.name: Reenforced Skeleton
datum.field: Toughens your skeleton and improves how smoothly it moves, improving your BLD by 1 point

datum.name: Replaced Skeleton (Flexible)
datum.field: A replacement for your normal skeleton. The bones are make of many individual joints, and can be bent at will. This enables you to perform amazing feats of contortion. +1 DEX -1 STR

datum.name: Replaced Skeleton (Rigid)
datum.field: A replacement for your normal skeleton. It has the ability to be locked rigid, giving you a +3 to STR contests, and an additional +1 BLD

datum.name: Self Sealing Blood Vessels
datum.field: Your blood vessels will seal themselves very effectivley if cut or otherwise damaged. You don't loose extra HP after going below 0, and don't bleed appreciably.

datum.name: Slick Skin
datum.field: Makes your skin unusually slick and slightly slimy. It makes it very difficult for something to grab you (-3), and slashing weapons have a tendency to slide off. (0/3/0)

datum.name: Spongy Skin
datum.field: Makes your skin tougher and thicker than normal. It cushions impact. (0/0/3)

datum.name: Subdermal Armor (heavy)
datum.field: Armored mesh is implanted below the skin. It is located everywhere execpt the face, groin, hands, and feet. Armor is 6/6/5. This is highly visible

datum.name: Subdermal Armor (light)
datum.field: Armored mesh is implanted below the skin. It is located everywhere execpt the face, groin, hands, and feet. Armor is 2/2/2. This is almost invisible

datum.name: Subdermal Armor (med)
datum.field: Armored mesh is implanted below the skin. It is located everywhere execpt the face, groin, hands, and feet. Armor is 4/4/4 this is visible if someone looks for it.,

datum.name: Suspended organs
datum.field: A special network of neuro-activated wire actuators suspends your vital organs. If something penetrates your body, they pull your organs out of the way. Take 50% piercing damage. Only works if you are not wearing any armor.

datum.name: Tail (balancing)
datum.field: A tail is added to the body. It is thick and sturdy. It improves your balance, giving +3 to balance-related DEX checks.

datum.name: Tail (cosmetic)
datum.field: A tail is added to the body. It has sensation, but has no real use other than cosmetics.

datum.name: Tail (prehensile)
datum.field: A tail is added to the body. It has DEX equal to your normal value. It can be used to hold onto things, etc. Also gives balance dex bonus

datum.name: Toxic Skin
datum.field: Enables you to secrete a weak poison from the skin. It is foul tasting, and deals 1D4-1 damage if ingested. Anything biting you must make a WILL check at -8 or immiedtly let go. (except robots, undead)

datum.name: Wing blades
datum.field: Addes blades to your wings that can be used as weapons. Use with unarmed combat. 3D6 damage.

datum.name: Wings
datum.field: Adds a set of wings to the body. They can be used to fly up to 20 MPH. Wings can retract inside the body for 2 slots and 6 more CP.

datum.name: Advanced Audio
datum.field: Hear a whisper from 100 meters away

datum.name: Advanced Olfactory System
datum.field: Increases senses of taste and smell by 4 times.

datum.name: Advanced Tasting
datum.field: Increase sense of taste by 100 times

datum.name: Alternate breathing passage
datum.field: Additional hole to breath from (can be anywhere on body)

datum.name: Anti-Dazzle
datum.field: Immune to flash and laser blinding

datum.name: Automatic Reticle
datum.field: Gives + 1 to strike with ranged weapons

datum.name: Chemical Identification
datum.field: Detect Hormonal changes, sweat, lie detect (as if at level 4), etc...

datum.name: Cold Breath
datum.field: must have 1 slot for fuel. 1D4 D, half damage against hard armor

datum.name: Cosmetic Ear change
datum.field: Change ears to look like anything you want

datum.name: Cosmetic Eye Change
datum.field: Change the look of any/all portions of the eye. This can be color of the iris, pupil, or any other portion of the eye. This can also include glowing eyes. Permanent change.

datum.name: Cyber hair
datum.field: Metallic hair, effect is cosmetic only

datum.name: Detachable Jaw
datum.field: Character can unhinge the jaw, allowing him or her to swallow objects up to 3 times normal size

datum.name: Disguise Face (Facial Features)
datum.field: Character can completely change his or her facial features, not including facial hair. This process takes a minute of concentration.

datum.name: Droud
datum.field: A device for stimulating the pleasure or pain centers of the brain directly.

datum.name: Dynamic Eye Changing
datum.field: Change the look of any/all portions of the eye. This can be color of the iris, pupil, or any other portion of the eye. This can also include glowing eyes. The look of the eyes can be changed at will, takes 15 seconds.

datum.name: Eye Laser
datum.field: 1D6+1 S. Can be used once per round.

datum.name: Eye Lights
datum.field: The eyes can act like flashlights, emiting a beam of light up to 100' away

datum.name: Eye Projector
datum.field: The eyes can project a holographic image of anything the character wishes. The image is unmistakable for a hologram, and will fool only the most stupid into believing what they are seeing. Has no sound.

datum.name: Eye flash
datum.field: The eyes can emit a bright flash, momentarily stunning those without an anti-dazzle system. Stunned victives are at -3 to all actions for 1D4 turns

datum.name: Facial Hair Control
datum.field: Character can completely change his or her facial & head hair. This includes style, sparseness, color, and placement

datum.name: False teeth
datum.field: Teeth are not natural, and they feel no pain

datum.name: Fangs
datum.field: Cosmetic. But if character has the Strengthened Bite implant, then fangs add +3 damage and changes damage to P.

datum.name: Fire Breathing
datum.field: must have 1 slot for fuel. 2D4 U

datum.name: Heat Sensor
datum.field: 20ft range. Detect exact temperature of surroundings.

datum.name: Maxwell Board
datum.field: Regenerates 1D4+1 HP per round. 1 Slot for power source

datum.name: Memory Board
datum.field: Acts as a file system for remembering things. It can store up to twenty-five different "memories". They can be accessed at will, and the information contained within will never be "forgotten".

datum.name: Microscopic Vision
datum.field: Increase magnification by up to 200 times but for only objects very close to character

datum.name: Movement Board
datum.field: +1 DEX in applications where speed isn't an issue (Delicate tasks, etc.). If you have a Flexible Skeleton, add +1 DEX all the time and an additional +1 DEX for slow tasks.

datum.name: Multispeech
datum.field: Can speak multiple things at once

datum.name: Noise Filter
datum.field: Immune to loud noises, and filters out background noise to hear someone in a noisy area

datum.name: Nose gun
datum.field: 1 Shell in a nostril. Fired from trigger in mouth. Can be any automatic pistol caliber. Cost adds to the cost of the gun you want to use; min STR has -2 for this use.

datum.name: Octopus Board
datum.field: Gives + 4 Brain slots. Only one can be used

datum.name: Output Jack
datum.field: Allows for electronic output from brain to interface with electronics, computers, etc.

datum.name: Prehensile Tongue
datum.field: Cosmetic only. Has a 3 Strength, and a Dexterity of the user.

datum.name: Psionic Board
datum.field: Allows the use of a single psionic power (must be purchased normally). Also opens character up to attacks from this type of psionic attack (assuming it's a mental attack)

datum.name: Remote Eye
datum.field: Remove eye from socket, wire connects to face

datum.name: Slotted Robotic Brain (SRB)
datum.field: A.I. reconstruction of the human brain. Work identically to a human brain. Contains 8 "brain slots" which may be utilized for special brain upgrades. Can be located anywhere in the body. Frees up 2 slots in head. The SRB takes up one slot, can be located anywhere.

datum.name: Spitting Glands
datum.field: Spit a poison up to 20'. 5 doses

datum.name: Suicide system
datum.field: At will, the character can kill himself, just by desiring to die

datum.name: Ultrasonic Pickup
datum.field: Alows hearing of very high frequency sound, like an animal.

datum.name: V-System Board
datum.field: Can turn on and off at will. When on, it will provide +2 WIS, +2 INT, and +1 action for 1D4-1 turns. Then, it has the opposite effect for two turns, before it can be activated again.

datum.name: Ventriliquist System
datum.field: Character can speak without opening the mouth.

datum.name: Vision System
datum.field: The eyes are replaced by mechanical versions that perform slightly better than their human counterparts. 4x normal vision

datum.name: Vocal Blast
datum.field: Deal 2D4 C damage to a target up to 100' away

datum.name: Vocal Screech
datum.field: Stun all listeners of the screech for 1d4 turns. All those stunned lose an action for the duration.

datum.name: Vocal System
datum.field: Increase vocal range by 4 times. Gives a +4 to the singing skill.

datum.name: Voice Modulator
datum.field: Can change characters voice to any recorded voice

datum.name: Volume Control
datum.field: Increase or decrease volume by up to 10 times.

datum.name: Wideband Camera
datum.field: Sees IR and UV Light reflections

datum.name: Climbing Feet
datum.field: A special set of feet designed to improve your ability to climb. -1 DEX for normal tasks. +4 to climbing rolls. When combined with Climbing hands, bonus is a total of +6

datum.name: Durable Feet
datum.field: The feet are made unusually durable. They will not develop blisters nor get tired, even when doing heavy work. Stubbing a toe or having your feet stepped on will no longer be as painful and is much less likely to cause injury.

datum.name: Extendable Legs
datum.field: The ability to extend your legs up to twice their normal length. You have -3 STR with the legs fully extended. They can be extended and contracted at wll.

datum.name: Foot Blades
datum.field: Retractible metal blades are implanted into the foot. They give +1 damage to kicks and deal S damage.

datum.name: Foot Sheild
datum.field: The sole of the foot is toughened with implants. This eliminates the need to wear shoes. You can walk on any normal terrain without hurting your feet. They can also be used to block attacks (if you are sufficiently skilled). The sole has 4/5/3 armor.

datum.name: Foot Thrusters
datum.field: Small rocket engines implanted into the foot allow you to jump 50% further than normal. They can also be used to accelerate the movement of the foot during a kick, adding +5 raw damage. Six uses before recharging.

datum.name: Heel Spike
datum.field: A metal spike is implanted into the heel. It makes it easier to run, walk, etc. on slippery surfaces. It also deals extra damage with kicks or stomps. (+1, P)

datum.name: Hollow leg
datum.field: Gives 3 slots in either leg. (two in thigh and one in calf)

datum.name: Jumping ability
datum.field: Can leap 10+3*X feet vertically or horizontally.

datum.name: Knee Spike
datum.field: A metal spike is implanted into the knee. It can be used to deal 1D6+1 P damage. It also protects the kneecap from injury.

datum.name: Speed increase
datum.field: Gives 5 additional MPH per purchase. Can be bought 4 times without needing space. Beyond that, every 4 purchases requires a slot.
